title: Android-Scan2Deploy Schema
description: Schema to validate Android JSON files given as input to DL-Config to generate Scan2Deploy barcodes

description.title: Description Schema
examples: This is for our Android devices

padlock.title: Padlock Schema
padlock.description: Section used to configure the staging locking feature

valid-until.title: Valid-Until Schema
valid-until.description: Specifies the expiration date of the barcode sequence. Device date must be synchronized/configured for expiration date to work properly.

key.title: Key Schema
key.description: Padlock key to be used. If value doesn't match the device, the barcode is rejected. Empty string means no key.

hide-from-launcher.title: Hide-From-Launcher Schema
hide-from-launcher.description: Indicates if Scan2Deploy should be disabled after staging is complete. Once disabled, factory reset required to reenable.

global.title: Global Schema
global.description: Section used to configure application scoped settings

target-path.title: Target-Path Schema
target-path.description: Base destination folder where any archive/fill will be inflated/written. Default is device internal SD-card root

install-path.title: Install-Path Schema
install-path.description: Folder where the application expects auto-installed/auto-updated APKs to be found. Default is value specified in 'target path'.

update-path.title: Update-Path Schema
update-path.description: Folder where the application expects auto-updated OTA packages to be found. Default is value specified in 'target path'.

purge-target-path.title: Purge-Target-Path Schema
purge-target-path.description: Indicates if target specified in 'target-path' needs to be purged (deleted) prior to inflation of the deployment archive

auto-scan.title: Auto-Scan Schema
auto-scan.description: Enables/Disables the auto-update of APKs and OTA packages

download-preinstalled.title: Download-Preinstalled Schema
download-preinstalled.description: Used to force the downgrade of pre-installed application (even System app), if required

script.title: Script Schema
script.description: A string specifying the absolute/relative path of a file, or a JSON array of strings describing the file content line-by-line. The script file will be interpreted last in staging process.

action.title: Action Schema
action.description: Specifies the final action performed by the application at the end of the staging process.

backup-to-enterprise.title: Backup-To-Enterprise Schema
backup-to-enterprise.description: Activates the enterprise backup persistence for the staging data, resulting in both the staging script and archive being copied to the enterprise partition

settings.title: Settings Schema
settings.description: Section used to control inner device settings that typically need to be changed from the Android defaults

date-time.title: Date-Time Schema
date-time.description: String representation in RFC-1123 format of the date to be set

auto-time.title: Auto-Time Schema
auto-time.description: Controls the 'Date & Time' automatic date-time adjustment setting

auto-time-zone.title: Auto-Time-Zone Schema
auto-time-zone.description: Controls the 'Date & Time' automatic time-zone adjustment setting

auto-time-server.title: Auto-Time-Server Schema
auto-time-server.description: Address of the NTP server to be used for date-time syncronizaiton

debug-bridge.title: Debug-Bridge Schema
debug-bridge.description: Controls the state of 'Android Debug Bridge'

lock-screen.title: Lock-Screen Schema
lock-screen.description: Controls the state of Android's lock-screen, requiring the user to swipe the display to unlock the device

status-bar.title: Status-Bar Schema
status-bar.description: Controls the display of the top status-bar. Note: hiding the status-bar will make notification disappear.

navigation-bar.title: Navigation-Bar Schema
navigation-bar.description: Controls the display of the bottom navigation-bar

charge-threshold.title: Charge-Threshold Schema
charge-threshold.description: Indicates the charge threshold a battery exhausted device needs to reach to automatically boot when recharging

network.title: Network Schema
network.description: Section used to configure the device Wi-Fi network

hidden.title: Hidden Schema
hidden.description: Indicates if the wireless network is using a hidden ESSID

mode-key-encrypted.title: Mode-Key-Encrypted Schema
mode-key-encrypted.description: Indicates if 'mode-key' is written in plain-text or encrypted with a custom encryption algorithm

eap-phase2.title: Eap-Phase2 Schema
eap-phase2.description: Configures the EAP phase 2 authentication method

eap-anonymous-identity.title: Eap-Anonymous-Identity Schema
eap-anonymous-identity.description: Indicates the EAP anonymous identity, used as the unencrypted identity with certain EAP types

eap-password-encrypted.title: Eap-Password-Encrypted Schema
eap-password-encrypted.description: Indicates if the 'eap-password' is encrypted with a custom encryption alogrithm

eap-certificate.title: Eap-Certificate Schema
eap-certificate.description: Base64 representation of the EAP certificate to use

proxy-host.title: Proxy-Host Schema
proxy-host.description: Server name or IP address of the proxy to be used for HTTP/HTTPS communications

proxy-port.title: Proxy-Port Schema
proxy-port.description: Server IP port of the proxy for HTTP/HTTPS communications

purge.title: Purge Schema
purge.description: Indicates if any currently configured wireless network needs to be removed. Can be useful to avoid profile roaming.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Schema
reconfigure.description: If true, will reconfigure any existing and matching network. If false, will leave existing network untouched. Setting used when 'purge' is set to false.

sleep-policy.title: Sleep-Policy Schema
sleep-policy.description: Wireless sleep policy for Android's Settings.Global parameter (0-WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_DEFAULT, 1-WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_NEVER_WHILE_PLUGGED, 2-WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_NEVER)

frequency-band.title: Frequency-Band Schema
frequency-band.description: Controls the frequency bands supported by the device

save-to-file.title: Save-To-File Schema
save-to-file.description: Absolute path to the file where the current network configuration will be saved, empty string indicates network configuration won't be serialized to a file

ephemeral.title: Ephemeral Schema
ephemeral.description: If true, wireless connection profile will be used during staging process, then deleted after staging. If false, wireless connection profile will still be present after staging process.

wait-for-connection.title: Wait-For-Connection Schema
wait-for-connection.description: Indicates whether a valid Wi-Fi connection has to be waited once the network configuration is complete. Can be useful when device needs to be configured but a valid Wi-Fi connection is not ready yet.

deployment.title: Deployment Schema
deployment.description: Section can be used to download a ZIP archive from a server and inflate it to the 'target-path' folder

host.title: Host Schema
host.description: Host-name or internet-protocol address of the server from which the resource is to be fetched

port.title: Port Schema
port.description: TCP/IP port to be used to contact the server

path.title: Path Schema
path.description: Path to the server resource to download, complete with query string if needed

fetch-timeout.title: Fetch-Timeout Schema
fetch-timeout.description: The timeout value used when fetching resource from host

check-timeout.title: Check-Timeout Schema
check-timeout.description: The timeout value used when attempting to reach the host server

working-archive.title: Working-Archive Schema
working-archive.description: String representation of the archive path-file name, once downloaded

skip-inflation.title: Skip-Inflation Schema
skip-inflation.description: Instructs the application not to inflate the deployment archive once downloaded, can be useful to speed the OTA update process up

blobs.title: Blobs Schema
blobs.description: Section used to transfer binary data to newly created file on device

file.title: File Schema
file.description: Path to the file to be created. Can be either absolute or relative to the global/target-path parameter value. During file de-serialization, any required (parent) path is automatically created.

content.title: Content Schema
content.description: Base64 representation of the actual file content
